metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1010204 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1010204` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-mips-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-mips64-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-mips64el-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-mipsel-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-multiarch - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnuspe - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-source - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm4').
